communications.communication:
Status Update for Taylor Amarel NGC19-501

Email:   79906-18732574@requests.muckrock.com

Dear Mr. Amarel:

This is in response to your email of July 14, 2021 requesting an estimated
completion date for your FOIA request NGC19-501 [*FOIAonline*
NARA-NGC-2019-000768].  Your request is currently #109 in our complex FOIA
queue.  We estimate completion of this request in 9 months from now.  This
is a conservative estimate since requests ahead of yours may move more
quickly through the queue.  If you have not received a response by this
estimated completion time, please contact us again for a status update.

Sincerely,

Jodi L. Foor

Deputy Freedom of Information Act Officer/Archivist

National Archives and Records Administration

Office of General Counsel

College Park, MD

FOIA@nara.gov

communications.communication:
Sent via Email<79906-18732574@requests.muckrock.com>



July 1, 2024


Taylor Amarel

MuckRock News, Dept MR 79906

411A Highland Ave

Somerville, MA 02144

79906-18732574@requests.muckrock.com


*RE: Freedom of Information Act Request Interim Release: NGC19-501 *



Dear Taylor Amarel:


This is the interim response to your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA)
request to the National Archives and Records Administration (NARA), dated
September 5, 2019, which was received in our office on the same via
*FOIAonline*.  We assigned your request internal tracking number
NGC19-501.

The released documents will come to you via a secure link from Serv-U File
Sharing.  Please click the link and use the following password to access
the document: *b8n317hK*

Thank you for contacting the National Archives and Records Administration.

Sincerely,

Jodi L. Foor

Deputy Freedom of Information Act Officer

National Archives and Records Administration

NARA Operational FOIA and Access Division

College Park, MD

301-837-2099

Jodi.Foor@nara.gov

communications.subject: Acknowledgement of request
communications.communication:
PRI-24-174


Dear Taylor Amarel:


We have received, from the National Archives and Records Administration, a partial referral of your request to them (NARA-NGC-2019-000768 ) and are processing it in accordance with our regulations concerning the availability of GAO records to the public, contained in 4 C.F.R. Part 81. Attached, for your information, is a copy of our regulations.


If you have any questions regarding the status of your request, please email me and reference the "PRI" case number at the top of this e-mail.

Additionally, please provide us your mailing address so we may have documentation for our case file.


Sincerely yours,

Francis A. Minor
Government Information Specialist,
U.S. Government Accountability Office
Audit Policy & Quality Assurance
441 G Street, NW
Washington, DC  20548

Sincerely yours,

Francis (Frank) Minor
Government Information Specalist

Washington, DC 20548

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Binghamton PD Grant Applications
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

All applications for grants submitted to DCJS by the Binghamton Police Department between January 1, 2010 and the present.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Chris Gelardi

communications.subject: RE: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Binghamton PD Grant Applications
communications.communication:
Dear Chris Gelardi:



This will acknowledge receipt of your request for records under the Freedom of Information Law received by the Division of Criminal Justice Services on March 22, 2024. The request was for "All applications for grants submitted to DCJS by the Binghamton Police Department between January 1, 2010 and the present."



Your request has been forwarded to the appropriate program area(s) to identify documents that are responsive to your request and which may be made available pursuant to all applicable provisions of the Freedom of Information Law.



A determination as to whether your request is granted or denied will be reached in approximately 20 business days or we will notify you in writing if the responsible program area(s) should require additional time to locate, assemble and review documents that may be responsive to your request.



Please note that, pursuant to Article 6 of the Public Officers Law, a charge may be applied to your request, including the actual cost of the medium used to respond to your Freedom of Information Law request and/or other related costs.  When responsive records have been identified, you will be informed of any cost and how payment should be made.







Very truly yours,


Brian Garvey, Esq.
Records Access Officer

files.title: ~WRD0001
files.source: New York State Division of Criminal Justice Services, New York

communications.subject: RE: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Binghamton PD Grant Applications

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

communications.subject: RE: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Binghamton PD Grant Applications
communications.communication:
Dear Chris Gelardi:

Please be advised that your request is under active review and we anticipate that a formal response to your inquiry will be provided to you by May 17, 2024. This additional time to respond is necessary due to the extensive number of FOIL requests that the Division is responding to and the time required to compile and review the records that are responsive to your request.
Very truly yours,


Brian Garvey
Records Access Officer

communications.subject: FW: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Binghamton PD Grant Applications
communications.communication:
Dear Chris Gelardi:

This is in response to your Freedom of Information Law (FOIL) request for "All applications for grants submitted to DCJS by the Binghamton Police Department between January 1, 2010 and the present."

Please find attached below 2 PDFs document that are responsive to your request.  Please note that pursuant to Sections 87(2)(b) and 87(2)(e)(iv) of the Public Officers Law (POL), certain portions have been redacted for personal privacy and to not reveal criminal investigative techniques or procedures.

Pursuant to POL §89(4)(a), you may appeal this determination within 30 days to the Counsel, Division of Criminal Justice Services, 80 South Swan St., Albany, NY 12210 or by email at foil@dcjs.ny.gov<mailto:foil@dcjs.ny.gov>.

Very truly yours,

Brian Garvey, Esq.
Records Access Officer

communications.subject: Fw: [EXTERNAL] New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
Dear Records Requestor:


Your request for information from the New Mexico Educational Retirement Board was forwarded to me. In accordance with the New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act (IPRA), “a written request shall provide the name, address and telephone number of the person seeking access to the records and shall identify the records sought with reasonable particularity.” Section 14-2-8(C) NMSA 1978.


If you will provide me with your name and mailing address, we can begin the process of allowing inspection of the relevant records.


The Inspection of Public Records Act can be found at 14-2-1 through 14-2-12 NMSA 1978.


Thank you.


Amanda Olsen



Amanda Olsen, Paralegal
NM Educational Retirement Board
PO Box 26129
Santa Fe, New Mexico 87502

(505) 827-8030 fax

My mailing address is 4521 N Central Park Ave. 3W, Chicago IL 60625. My phone number is 781-962-8816. Please feel free to give me a call if it's helpful to discuss any portion of this request. 

Thank you!

communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Scroggins and Ms. Olsen,

Thanks for the update. Can you provide any additional info regarding the source of delays on this request, or the estimated delivery date? Please feel free to give me a call at 781-962-8816 if it'd be helpful to discuss the scope of the materials we're requesting.

communications.subject: RE: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Rock,

I am responding to your email yesterday requesting any additional info regarding the source of delays on this request. Please be assured that we make every effort to respond promptly to every request. However, we must also ensure that we are diligent and accurate in our reply. Thus, when obtained, all documents and emails must be reviewed. Additionally, we must rely on the state agency that controls the entire state email system to identify and provide the emails requested. As you can imagine, the process takes time.

As to an estimated response date, in our letter of August 1, 2023, we noted that we intend to respond by September 6, 2023.

Thank you for your patience and please feel free to contact me if you have further questions.

Respectfully,

[cid:image001.png@01D9C623.0D3F7D80]

Hello Ms. Garcia,

Thank you for the update. Given that it's now been five months since we filed the initial request, are you able to provide an update as to whether you've identified the responsive documents, or what the source of the delay is?

Thank you,

Rebecca

communications.subject: ATTORNEY CLIENT PRIVILEGED - RE: [EXTERNAL] RE: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Rock and Ms. Burns,

Thank you for your inquiry and please accept our apologies for the delay.

As Mr. Scroggins noted in his August 3, 2023 email regarding our projected response, we always try to be prompt.  But as you might guess, the request references a large number of records.  As he said, we must thoroughly review all records to identify and obtain the responsive documents from both external and internal sources.  It is a complex and time-consuming process.

I am confident that we will have documents ready to provide on or before the December 6th, 2023, date noted in our recent communication.

Thank you for your continued patience!
Regards,
Renee



[cid:image002.png@01DA121F.C2136CB0]

Julia Rock

communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Rock and Ms. Burns:

As discussed in our letter of December 6, 2023, we are providing the records we currently have available in response to your June 16, 2023, request.  They are located at the website below:

MuckRock - Julia Rock<https://nmgov-my.sharepoint.com/:f:/r/personal/renee_garcia_erb_nm_gov/Documents/MuckRock%20-%20Julia%20Rock?csf=1&web=1&e=4gwfSH>

As also discussed, we will require additional time to provide the remainder of the records.  We plan to provide additional documents on or before February 1, 2024.  Thank you again for your continued patience regarding this matter.
Regards,
Renee

title: FOIA Request: FY23 Organized Retail Crime Grant Program

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: FOIA Request: FY23 Organized Retail Crime Grant Program
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

A copy of all documents, including but not limited to, applications, agreements, and reporting documents related to the $276,000 awarded to Cook County for the FY23 Organized Retail Crime Grant program.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

e

communications.subject: [Records Center] Welcome to the Public Records Center!
communications.communication:
Dear e e, 
 
Thank you for registering with the Cook County Office under the President Public Records Center. 
 
Your Login ID is:  168640-96794450@requests.muckrock.com 
 
If you did not submit your request through the public portal but are receiving this e-mail, an account has been created for you where you can track and monitor the status of your request, and receive any documents in response to your request. 
 
 
If you have never used this system or cannot remember your password you may request a temporary password here: Request Temporary Password (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=u001.VEsWrlMiJDg0mXafq1mEXeCrtESNocv1RM3WKAglBaY-2F-2BPD9MwY-2BJfIE2wZxXTmeOaILjKV46Jfxk2yt7kSri2l6ESzOiKp59va8PrT7FCE-3DdbHT_U3npebCqykTgHy489gNhQsDrjy7MOW0iV2z1Ku5NcBgSdxEM5lnyem4ao5kjM2uFOUWcMgIDIXoOCaz-2FkdCjSi5phCwflkmcwgpe06nOHw9ztW7YYFair5RbYpFxrpOmf-2FYz2MPK02EDDZJHDrfdAXZ8aqZ28c0qXPXiIvZvhLXjpNEojOjtRUbrVj8FsIw4XjV77xLVmMdm057vGMmph9v9XQDfV-2FgTUNXptAbQ97Y-3D) 
 
Please login to "My Request Center" to update your account information, track the status of your request and receive requested records when they become available. 
 
Thank you, 
Rachel 
 
 
Rachel Dailey 
Administrative Assistant V & FOIA Officer 
Office of the President

communications.subject: FOIA Request :: R004772-071024
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

 
July 18, 2024 
RE: FOIA # R004772-071024 
To whom it may concern, 
The Office of the President of the Cook County Board of Commissioners is in receipt of your request for information under the Freedom of Information Act (the "Act"). 
On July 10, 2024, we received your request for the following: 
To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records: 

A copy of all documents, including but not limited to, applications, agreements, and reporting documents related to the $276,000 awarded to Cook County for the FY23 Organized Retail Crime Grant program. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fcook-county-clerk-12324%252Ffoia-request-fy23-organized-retail-crime-grant-program-168640%252F%253Femail%253DFOIA.CCClerk%252540cookcountyil.gov&url_auth_token=AAA7flvvULVbhVKuxURSGlC6WJg%3A1sRkwo%3AEffC7NKgNy6Ru_RqL47mg7RlvlGfHQn0wRoRxMK_Wow 
Under the Act, a public body may extend the time to respond to a request by up to five (5) business days for a limited number of reasons.  5 ILCS 140/3(e).  We are extending the time to respond to your requests by five (5) business days because there is a need for consultation, which shall be conducted with all practicable speed, among two or more components of a public body having a substantial interest in the subject matter of the request.  5 ILCS 140/3(e)(vii). 

We will respond to your request by July 25, 2024. 
Thank you, 
Rachel 
Rachel Dailey 
Administrative Assistant V & FOIA Officer 
Office of the President 
(O) 312-603-0002 
Rachel.Dailey@cookcountyil.gov

communications.subject: FOIA Request :: R004772-071024
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

 
July 24, 2024 
RE: FOIA # R004772-071024 
To whom it may concern, 
The Office of the President of the Cook County Board of Commissioners is in receipt of your request for information under the Freedom of Information Act (the "Act"). 
On July 10, 2024, we received your request for the following: 
To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records: 

A copy of all documents, including but not limited to, applications, agreements, and reporting documents related to the $276,000 awarded to Cook County for the FY23 Organized Retail Crime Grant program. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fcook-county-clerk-12324%252Ffoia-request-fy23-organized-retail-crime-grant-program-168640%252F%253Femail%253DFOIA.CCClerk%252540cookcountyil.gov&url_auth_token=AAA7flvvULVbhVKuxURSGlC6WJg%3A1sRkwo%3AEffC7NKgNy6Ru_RqL47mg7RlvlGfHQn0wRoRxMK_Wow 
Records responsive to your request are available for you to download online at the following link. Please be advised that employee identification numbers and personal cell phone numbers have been redacted, pursuant to sections 2(c-5) and 7(1)(b) of the Act. 5 ILCS 140/2(c-5); 5 ILCS 140/7(1)(b). 
Pursuant to section 9 of the Act, please note that the undersigned is responsible for this partial denial.  You have a right to have the denial of your request reviewed by the Public Access Counselor (PAC) at the Office of the Illinois Attorney General.  5 ILCS 140/9.5(a).  You can file your Request for Review with the PAC by writing to: FOIA Request - R004772-071024 
Public Access Counselor 
Office of the Attorney General 
500 South 2nd Street 
Springfield, Illinois 62706 
Fax: (217) 782-1396 
E-mail: public.access@ilag.gov 
You also have the right to seek judicial review of your denial by filing a lawsuit in the State circuit court. 5 ILCS 140/11. 

If you choose to file a Request for Review with the PAC, you must do so within 60 calendar days of the date of this denial letter.  5 ILCS 140/9.5(a).  Please note that you must include hard copies of your original FOIA requests and this denial letter when filing a Request for Review with the PAC. 
Thank you, 
Rachel 
Rachel Dailey 
Administrative Assistant V & FOIA Officer 
Office of the President 
(O) 312-603-0002 
Rachel.Dailey@cookcountyil.gov
